title: Activity Theory-Based Asynchronous Learning Network (ALN) Design Process

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Digital Literacy and Foundational Knowledge in Language Learning
context.additional_context: Asynchronous learning environment emphasizing learner role division and collaboration

learning_goals: Learners can analyze an ALN (Activity-Centered Learning Network) design framework using components of activity theory (subject, tools, rules, community, etc.).
Learners can operate a technical support system (feedback, scheduling, interaction guidelines) in an LMS environment with over 85% accuracy.
Learners can improve language learning achievement by over 20% through role-based collaborative activity design.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
